question: Which state government is to launch 45 fast track special courts to ensure speedy trial of cases involving crime against women and children?
explanation:
The Odisha State government has planned to set up 45 fast-track special courts (FTSC) in the State. It aims to ensure speedy trial of cases involving crime against women and children. The announcement was made by the State law minister Pratap Jena.
The state also stated that of the total 45 courts, 21 courts will deal with cases that are related to rape and sexual assault. The 24 other courts will exclusively deal with cases that were registered under the protection of children from sexual offences (POCSO) Act. Â 24 courts have already been established. The courts will soon be made functional. They are aimed to deal with POCSO cases.
